      • initPattern

        public Pattern initPattern(int id,
                  android.os.Bundle args,
                  PatternManager.PatternCallbacks callback)
        Ensures a pattern is initialized and active. If the pattern doesn't already exist, one is created and (if the activity/fragment is currently started). Otherwise the last created pattern is re-used.

        In either case, the given callback is associated with the pattern, and will be called as the pattern state changes.

        Parameters:
        id - A unique identifier for this pattern. Can be whatever you want. Identifiers are scoped to a particular PatternManager instance.
        args - Optional arguments to supply to the pattern at construction. If a pattern already exists (a new one does not need to be created), this parameter will be ignored and the last arguments continue to be used.
        callback - Interface the PatternManager will call to report about changes in the state of the pattern. Required.
        Returns:

      • getPattern

        public Pattern getPattern(int id)
        Return the Pattern with the given id or null if no matching Pattern is found.
        Parameters:
        id - A unique identifier for this pattern. Can be whatever you want. Identifiers are scoped to a particular PatternManager instance.
        Returns:
        The pattern with the given id or null if no matching Pattern is found.

      • destroyPattern

        public void destroyPattern(int id)
        Stops and removes the pattern with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the pattern you want to remove.
